bibl.title: Letter from E.S. Adams to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1940

div1.p: Adams has forwarded Hench's letter requesting copies of maps.

div1.head: Letter from E.S. Adams to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1940
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT
THE ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON
September 26, 1940.
IN REPLY AG 095-Hench, Philip S., Dr.
REFER TO (9-18-40)M
ESA
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I am directed by the Secretary of War to acknow-
ledge the receipt of your letter of recent date, relative to
an address which you are to give on the occasion of the
dedication of the Lazear Memorial Building and requesting
copies of maps which show the exact sites of Camp Columbia
and Columbia Barracks.

Your letter has been noted in the Department and
the correspondence has been transmitted to the agency con-
cerned for consideration.

Upon receipt of further information I will write
you again.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, E S Adams
Major General,
The Adjutant General.
